tensorrt.launcher.desc: Path to script that launches TensorRT benchmarks.

tensorrt.env.desc: Environmental variables to set for TensorRT benchmarks.

desc: A path to store calibration caches for TensorRT when running in INT8 inference regime.
If empty, no cache will be used and calibration will be done with every benchmark what's
not desireable for models that's input size is large. The advice is to run quick runs for
every model with this path set what will result in cache being populated. Then run real benchmarks
Report progress every N-th processed batch. Default value (-1) means do not report progress,

tensorrt.no_batch_times.desc: If set, DLBS won't log individual batch times.

desc: Method to resize images: normal resize or crop. Resize is expensive, crop is not.
If crop is not applicable due to image being smaller, resize is used instead.

tensorrt.num_decoders.desc: Number of decoder threads (preprocessors that convert images to tensors).

tensorrt.prefetch_queue_size.desc: Maximal number of batches of images in a queue of loaded but non-decoded images.

desc: If set, fake decoder will be used. Fake decoder is a decoder that does not decode JPEG images into
different representation, but just passes through itself inference requests. This option is useful
If set, fake inference engine will be used. Fake engine is an engine that does not perform inference.
It just fetches requests and pushes them immidiiately into response queue. This option is useful
to benchmark ingestion pipeline and/or storage.

val: --cache $('' if '${tensorrt.cache}' == '' else '${tensorrt.cache}' if ${exp.docker} is False else '/workspace/tensorrt_cache')$
$('' if not '${exp.data_dir}' else '--data_dir=${exp.data_dir}' if ${exp.docker} is False else '--data_dir=/workspace/data/')$
tensorrt.args.desc: Command line arguments that launcher uses to launch TensorRT.

tensorrt.model_dir.desc: Directory where Caffe's model file is located. Different for host/docker benchmarks.

tensorrt.docker_image.desc: The name of a docker image to use for TensorRT.

tensorrt.docker_args.desc: In case if containerized benchmarks, this are the docker parameters.

tensorrt.profile.desc: If true, per layer statistics are measured.

tensorrt.input.desc: Name of an input data tensor (data)

tensorrt.host_path.desc: Path to a tensorrt executable in case of bare metal run.

tensorrt.host_libpath.desc: Basically, it's a LD_LIBRARY_PATH for TensorRT in case of a bare metal run (should be empty).

desc: *** This parameter is not used since TensorRT backend does not support real data. ***
*** It is here for compatibility reasons with exp.data_dir ***
Name of an input dataset - 'images' or 'tensors'
